lexUnit.name: whimper.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to cry or sob softly and intermittently

sentence.text: He whimpered no more and lay on the concrete , silent .
The wind lashed at the frontage , rattling those panes … and Gilbert was whimpering again .
He was whimpering quietly .
The child , a girl of about five , was whimpering softly , the skin of her legs and bottom already peeling .
As I gave the injection the dog whimpered a little and the boy stretched out a hand and patted him .
Expertly held , the monkey began whimpering again , his sad eyes looking at them imploringly , and Sophie 's heart was wrung with pity .
Then , hearing a sound , she raised her head from her hands to see Rob creeping over the snow towards her , whimpering slightly .
She whimpered and wriggled further into the chesterfield 's cushiony depths .
He could n't sleep , or he thought he could n't , for Hazel said that all night long he whimpered and gnashed .
Topaz did n't whimper or plead .
Occasionally the baby whimpered and she jiggled the handle of the pram until it stopped .
He whimpered with the pain of it , and caressed the fingers lovingly with his good hand .
He began to whimper with fear .
The boy was whimpering with pain and his left leg was twisted awkwardly .
The sight of it made him whimper like a child and fall to his knees again .
Sousan whimpered from somewhere close by .
They staggered together from the tunnel , whimpering with agony …
The girl whimpered into his shirt , and Lissa began to feel sick .
I whimpered like a wounded puppy dog .
My body was all there , trembling , whimpering in the graphic light , but all there .
Rincewind trailed behind , whimpering at intervals and checking to see that his head was still there .
She heard Elaine whimper .
He heard the dog whimper .
The boys gave her dark looks , and Hoomey actually whimpered .
